findings.label: Paid During Active Breaches
findings.detail: 4 suppliers received payments while in breach of Companies Act. The lowest breach spend of the 3 East Lancashire councils.

findings.label: Highest Transaction Volume
findings.detail: More transactions than Burnley (30,580) and Hyndburn (29,804) despite the lowest total spend (£125M). Driven by vehicle hire and fuel micro-payments.

findings.label: Suspected Split Payments
findings.detail: 777 instances of 3+ payments just below approval thresholds in the same week — may indicate circumvention of procurement rules

findings.label: Fuel Micro-Payments
findings.detail: FUELMATE LTD received 5,047 individual payments averaging £159 each. Consolidating these into monthly invoices would reduce admin costs.

findings.label: Year-End Spending Pattern
findings.detail: March spending is flat at 1.0x the monthly average. April is actually the peak month. No evidence of year-end budget rush.

key_findings.title: Marston (Holdings) Ltd: £17.1K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: Filed dormant accounts but receiving council payments for enforcement services.

key_findings.title: Jewson Ltd: £17.0K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: Filed dormant accounts but receiving council payments for building supplies.

key_findings.title: Go Plant Fleet Services: 210+ identical payments of £3,540
key_findings.description: Individual vehicle hire charges for fleet vehicles. Not duplicates — each is a separate vehicle rental, but volume highlights fleet management costs.

key_findings.title: FUELMATE LTD: 5,047 transactions totalling £800.2K
key_findings.description: Averaging £159 per transaction — the council's most frequent supplier by volume. Individual fuel fill-ups rather than consolidated invoicing.

key_findings.title: 44 suppliers shared with neighbouring councils — £40.2M total
key_findings.description: Compare what each council pays the same suppliers for similar services.

key_findings.title: WALTON SUMMIT TRUCK CENTRE LTD: very different service scopes
key_findings.description: Burnley pays £56K avg per transaction vs Pendle £49 — likely reflects vehicle purchases vs parts/servicing, not price gouging.
